intro: Lopezia trichota, commonly known as the hairy Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense, flat-topped inflorescences. Lopezia trichota is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and a subject of study in ecological and taxonomic research.
